sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"事情"之意。
means: affair ：含义较广，侧重指已发生或必须去做的任何事情或事务。复数形式多指重大或较复杂的事务。
business ：通常指较重要或较难而又必须承担的事情，也可指商事。
matter ：普通用词，着重指一件考虑中的或需要处理的事。
concern ：往往强调与个人或团体利害有直接或重大关系的事。
thing ：用作"事情"解时，词义较笼统、含糊，多用于指不很具体的事。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"贸易，交易"之意。
means: business ： 指包括售货、购货、换货在内的综合商业活动，方式可以是批发或零售。
commerce ： 多指大规模的买卖或易货关系。
trade ： 普通用词，含义广。既可指某种具体的商业又可指广泛的贸易。
bargain ： 多指买卖双方通过谈判、协商就商品质量、数量、价格等项达成协议所成的生意。
deal ： 口语用词，指买卖双方经过交涉达成协议成交。

sentence.Network_en: Very likely he'd told them he had American business interests.
sentence.Network_cn: 很可能他已经告诉他们自己拥有美国商业利益.

sentence.Network_en: He mixed business and pleasure in a perfect and dynamic way.
sentence.Network_cn: 他以互动的方式将工作和娱乐完美地结合起来。

sentence.Network_en: The Jamaica Festival is planning a series of workshops and business seminars.
sentence.Network_cn: 牙买加节正在筹划一系列研习班和商务研讨会。

jx.jx_en_mean: an ongoing and unchanging state of affairs despite difficulties or disturbances

lj.lj_ly: apart from being under new management, it's business as usual in the department.
lj.lj_ls: 除了管理层变了，该部门情况一切如常。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)do what is required to achieve the desired result
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)（为达目标）采取必要行动，把事加成

lj.lj_ly: Rogers has got to do the business, score a hat trick or something.
lj.lj_ls: 罗杰斯必须来解决问题，玩个帽子戏法什么的。

jx.jx_en_mean: have no right to do something

lj.lj_ly: he had no business tampering with social services.
lj.lj_ls: 他无权干涉社会公益服务活动。

lj.lj_ly: they will have to import from overseas to remain in business.
lj.lj_ls: 为维持经营他们必须从国外进口。

jx.jx_en_mean: engaged in or prepared to engage in

lj.lj_ly: I am not in the business of making accusations.

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)非常高的程度（或标准）

lj.lj_ly: these weeds spread like nobody's business.

jx.jx_en_mean: refrain from meddling in other people's affairs

lj.lj_ly: he was yelling at her to get out and mind her own business.
lj.lj_ls: 他向她大喊，让她滚，别多管闲事。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (旧)把某人打发走；叫某人不要多管闲事

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  bisignis 'anxiety' (see busy, -ness); the sense 'state of being busy' was used from Middle English  down to the 18th cent., but is now differentiated as busyness. The use 'appointed task' dates from late Middle English , and from it all the other current senses have developed

encyclopedia.content: 简介 business英音：['biznis]美音：['bɪznɪs] 名词 n. 1. 生意,交易；商业；营业；行业[U][C] Mr. Jones is in the business of selling cars. 琼斯先生从事汽车销售。 How is business? 生意如何？ 2. 商店；商行；公司；企业[C] She started a new business in Phoenix not long ago. 不久前她在凤凰城新开了一家公司。 3. 职责，本分；分内事；权利[U] This is none of your business. 这与你不相干。 4.

entry.def: Business is work relating to the production, buying, and selling of goods or services.

example.ex: ...young people seeking a career in business...
example.tran: 涉足商界的年轻人

example.ex: Jennifer has an impressive academic and business background.
example.tran: 珍妮弗有着让人印象深刻的学术和商务背景。

entry.def: Business is used when talking about how many products or services a company is able to sell. If business is good, a lot of products or services are being sold and if business is bad, few of them are being sold.

example.ex: They worried that German companies would lose business...
example.tran: 他们担心德国公司的业务量会下滑。

example.ex: Business is booming.
example.tran: 生意蒸蒸日上。

entry.tran: 工商企业；公司；商店；商铺
entry.def: A business is an organization which produces and sells goods or which provides a service.

example.ex: The company was a family business...
example.tran: 这家公司是个家族企业。

example.ex: The majority of small businesses go broke within the first twenty-four months...
example.tran: 大多数小企业在开张后的24个月内就倒闭了。

entry.def: Business is work or some other activity that you do as part of your job and not for pleasure.

example.ex: I'm here on business...
example.tran: 我到这儿来办公事。

example.ex: You can't mix business with pleasure.
example.tran: 你不能把工作和娱乐搅在一起。

entry.def: You can use business to refer to a particular area of work or activity in which the aim is to make a profit.

example.ex: May I ask you what business you're  in?
example.tran: 我可否问问你是做什么工作的？

example.ex: ...the music business.
example.tran: 音乐界

entry.tran: 眼前所做之事；手头的事
entry.def: You can use business to refer to something that you are doing or concerning yourself with.

example.ex: ...recording Ben as he goes about his business...
example.tran: 录下本在处理事务时的镜头片断

example.ex: There was nothing left for the teams to do but get on with the business of racing.
example.tran: 这些队除了继续参加赛跑比赛，没有什么别的事可做。

entry.def: You can use business to refer to important matters that you have to deal with.

example.ex: The most important business was left to the last...
example.tran: 最重要的事留到最后来解决。

example.ex: I've got some unfinished business to attend to.
example.tran: 我还有一些未完的事要处理。

entry.def: If you say that something is your business, you mean that it concerns you personally and that other people have no right to ask questions about it or disagree with it.

example.ex: My sex life is my business...
example.tran: 我的性生活是我自己的事。

example.ex: If she doesn't want the police involved, that's her business...
example.tran: 如果她不想让警方介入，那是她自己的事。

entry.def: You can use business to refer in a general way to an event, situation, or activity. For example, you can say something is 'a wretched business' or you can refer to 'this assassination business'.

example.ex: We have sorted out this wretched business at last...
example.tran: 我们最终还是把这件破事儿理顺了。

example.ex: This whole business is very puzzling.
example.tran: 这件事从头到尾都很让人费解。

entry.tran: （令人不快或耗费钱财的）活儿，事情
entry.def: You can use business when describing a task that is unpleasant in some way. For example, if you say that doing something is a costly business, you mean that it costs a lot.

example.ex: Coastal defence is a costly business...
example.tran: 海防事务很耗费资财。

example.ex: Parenting can be a stressful business.
example.tran: 为人父母会是一件压力很大的事。

entry.def: If two people or companies do business with each other, one sells goods or services to the other.

example.ex: I was fascinated by the different people who did business with me.
example.tran: 我对那些跟我做生意的形形色色的人非常感兴趣。

entry.def: If you say that someone has no business to be in a place or to do something, you mean that they have no right to be there or to do it.

example.ex: Really I had no business to be there at all.
example.tran: 真的，我根本没有道理呆在那里。

entry.def: A company that is in business is operating and trading.

example.ex: You can't stay in business without cash.
example.tran: 没有现金，你无法运营。

entry.def: If you say you are in business, you mean you have everything you need to start something immediately.

example.ex: All you need is a microphone, and you're in business.
example.tran: 再来一只麦克风，你就万事俱备了。

entry.def: If you say that someone means business, you mean they are serious and determined about what they are doing.

example.ex: Now people are starting to realise that he means business.
example.tran: 人们现在才开始明白他不是在开玩笑。

entry.def: If you say to someone 'mind your own business' or 'it's none of your business', you are rudely telling them not to ask about something that does not concern them.

example.ex: I asked Laura what was wrong and she told me to mind my own business.
example.tran: 我问劳拉发生了什么事，她让我少管闲事。

entry.def: If you make it your business to do something, you decide to do it, because you are interested in it or because you want to find out something.

example.ex: She made it her business to find out.
example.tran: 她决定要查明真相。

entry.def: If you say that you are not in the business of doing something, you are emphasizing that you do not do it, usually when you are annoyed or surprised that someone thinks you do.

example.ex: We are not in the business of subsidising scroungers.
example.tran: 我们是不会资助那些乞丐的。

entry.def: If a shop or company goes out of business or is put out of business, it has to stop trading because it is not making enough money.

example.ex: Thousands of firms could go out of business.
example.tran: 成千上万个企业可能破产。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is the business, you mean that they are the best of their kind.

example.ex: When you watch him in training, you realise that this lad is the business.
example.tran: 当你观看他训练时，你就会意识到这个小伙子是最棒的。

entry.def: In a difficult situation, if you say it is business as usual, you mean that people will continue doing what they normally do.

example.ex: The Queen was determined to show it was business as usual.
example.tran: 女王决定表现出一切正常的样子。

means.word_mean: 1. a commercial or industrial enterprise and the people who constitute it;
2. the activity of providing goods and services involving financial and commercial and industrial aspects;

sentences.sentence: "computers are now widely used in business"
"show me where the business was today"

means.word_mean: 6. the principal activity in your life that you do to earn money;

sentences.sentence: "he's not in my line of business"
"gossip was the main business of the evening"

means.word_mean: 8. incidental activity performed by an actor for dramatic effect;

sentences.sentence: "his business with the cane was hilarious"

list.explanation: 受到责罚、申斥、粗暴对待、虐待

example.en: When they found out his record he got the business.
example.zh: 他们一查清广他的底细，他就挨整了。

auth_sentence.content: It's a funny thing, this music business.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's a funny thing, this music business.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's a funny thing, this music business.

auth_sentence.content: For people here it is just business as normal.
auth_sentence.res_content: For people here it is just business as normal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For people here it is just business as normal.

auth_sentence.content: Pretty soon it gained popularity and became big business.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pretty soon it gained popularity and became big business.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pretty soon it gained popularity and became big business.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表名词,"性质,状态",通常加在形容词后面

stems_affixes.word_buile: bright明亮的+ness性质,状态→n.明亮,辉煌,聪明
busi+ness性质,状态→n.商业,买卖,交易,生意
careful小心的,仔细的+ness性质,状态→n.仔细,慎重
clean清洁+li+ness性质,状态→cleanliness洁癖,清洁

stems_affixes.value_cn: 意识,知觉,自觉,觉悟,个人思想
stems_affixes.word_buile: conscious意识到的+ness性质,状态→n.意识,知觉,自觉,觉悟,个人思想
dark黑暗+ness性质,状态→n.黑暗,阴暗,秘密
empty空的+ness性质,状态→emptiness空虚,无知
firm坚定+ness性质,状态→n.坚定,稳固
forward向前的,鲁莽的+ness性质,状态→n.大胆,鲁莽
fulsome过度的,虚假的+ness性质,状态→n.虚情,谄媚

stems_affixes.value_cn: 仁慈,亲切;好意;友好行为
stems_affixes.word_buile: kind仁慈的,和蔼的+ness性质,状态→n.仁慈,亲切;好意;友好行为
like像+ness性质,状态→n.相象,相似物
polite有礼貌的+ness性质,状态→n.有礼,优雅
positive肯定的+ness性质,状态→n.肯定,信心
pretentious自命不凡的+ness性质,状态→n.自命不凡
prompt敏捷的,迅速的,即时的+ness性质,状态→n.敏捷,迅速
tight紧的+ness性质,状态→n.坚固,紧密
tired疲乏的+ness性质,状态→n.疲劳,疲倦
useful有用的+ness性质,状态→n.有用,有效性
useless无用的+ness性质,状态→n.无用
weak弱的,虚弱的+ness性质,状态→n.虚弱,软弱,弱点,缺点
thick厚的+ness性质,状态→n.厚度,浓度,稠密

sentences.en: The company has done business with many countries.
sentences.cn: 该公司与许多国家做生意。

sentences.en: They are now doing almost twice as much business as they were last year.
sentences.cn: 他们现在的营业额几乎为去年的两倍。

means.word_mean: 工商企业, 商店; 行业, 事业

sentences.en: Many a large and big business has been built up from small ones.
sentences.cn: 很多重要的大企业都是从小规模发展起来的。

means.word_mean: 职责, 关心的事, 本分, 任务

sentences.en: He was sensible enough to mind his own business.
sentences.cn: 他颇有见识, 不去管闲事。

sentences.en: A teacher's business is to help children learn.
sentences.cn: 教师的本分是帮助孩子学习。

means.word_mean: 事情; 事务, 业务

sentences.en: The insurance business is built on trust.
sentences.cn: 保险业建立在信任的基础上。

jushi.english: Has your business been attended to by her in your absence?
jushi.chinese: 你不在的时候,事务一直由她处理吗?

jushi.english: The old woman is curious about other people's business.
jushi.chinese: 这位老太婆爱打听别人的事。
